MS MCQs

    Use effects in Xamarin.Forms - Configure an effect by using attached bindable properties

    »

    1. In Xamarin.Forms, which statement best describes elements such as Button and Entry?

      Run-time visuals that are displayed to the user

      Model objects that rely on native controls for their visualization

      UI types that derive from platform-specific control classes

      UI types that display only a single piece of content


    2. In Xamarin.Forms, how many effects can you apply to an element, such as a Button?

      None

      One

      Unlimited


    3. In Xamarin.Forms, suppose you’re writing a custom effect. It’s common to create a class in the shared code that derives from RoutingEffect. You can add properties to this class to pass values from the shared code to the platform effects. What is an advantage of implementing these as attached properties rather than regular C# properties?

      Attached properties are easier to code than C# properties

      Attached properties are more type safe than C# properties

      Attached properties include built-in change notification

      Attached properties can be nullable, and C# properties can’t.


    4. In Xamarin.Forms, suppose you’re coding a custom effect. You write a class that derives from PlatformEffect on each platform. How is your platform effect notified when one of the properties on the Xamarin.Forms element changes?

      You subscribe to the PropertyChanged event

      You override the OnElementPropertyChanged method

      You override the OnElementChanged method

      You use MessagingCenter.Subscribe to register for notifications
